docs.lead_paragraph: Pharmaceutical companies cannot depend on ever increasing prices in the United States and will need to find a new balance between incentives for innovation and access to medicines, according to the chief executive of GlaxoSmithKline.

headline.main: Don't Bank on U.S. Drug Price Rises, Warns GSK Boss
headline.print_headline: Don't Bank on U.S. Drug Price Rises, Warns GSK Boss

docs.snippet: Pharmaceutical companies cannot depend on ever increasing prices in the United States and will need to find a new balance between incentives for innovation and access to medicines, according to the chief executive of GlaxoSmithKline.

docs.lead_paragraph: An Annals of Internal Medicine paper reports that the money needed to treat dementia in a patient’s final five years is greater than for heart disease and cancer.

headline.main: Costs for Dementia Care Far Exceeding Other Diseases, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Dementia Is Draining Families’ Bank Accounts

docs.abstract: Study in Annals of Internal Medicine finds that for many families, cost of caring for dementia patient frequently takes almost all their household wealth; many costs for dementia patients, unlike those of cancer or heart disease patients, are not covered by Medicare.
docs.snippet: An Annals of Internal Medicine paper reports that the money needed to treat dementia in a patient’s final five years is greater than for heart disease and cancer.

headline.main: The Promise of Genetic Testing in Medicine

docs.abstract: Is the enthusiasm for applying DNA sequencing to health care overblown?
docs.snippet: Is the enthusiasm for applying DNA sequencing to health care overblown?
